explanation: The report is correct. Right after res is set to MHD_YES, the very next controlling expression if (MHD_NO != res) is always true (assuming MHD_YES and MHD_NO are distinct). That controlling expression is therefore invariant at the point it is evaluated and so does not satisfy MISRA C:2023 Rule 14.3 (controlling expressions shall not be invariant). The rule's listed exceptions (infinite-loop invariants or the specific do-while constant-false case) do not apply here. Note: later if statements in the chain are not necessarily invariant because res may be changed by the preceding function calls, but the first if is invariant and is sufficient to report a violation.
